results.title: Muscular and mechanical movements
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Digestion”.
Deals with the muscular processes involved in the digestion of food. The film demonstrates mechanical and muscular processes of mastication and swallowing; peristalsis in the oesophagus, small intestine, and colon; segmentation in the small intestine; contraction waves in the cardiac and pyloric regions of the stomach; absorption of food into the blood from the small intestine, and of water and salts from the colon. No other credits available.

results.title: Muscles and movement
results.creator_credit: Jack Smith and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Living Body”.
Designed for 11 to 14 year olds, the film illustrates aspects of the skeleton and muscles, using resources not available in the classroom or school laboratory. Uses clinical techniques, anatomical models and preparations selected to demonstrate body functions.

results.title: Muscles and bones of the body
results.brief_description: The importance of the muscles and bones to the internal and external functioning of the human body. How tendons, joints, muscles and the bones of the skeleton work smoothly together as one unit. The difference between voluntary and involuntary muscles and the importance of proper exercise and diet to a healthy body.
results.description: The importance of the muscles and bones to the internal and external functioning of the human body. results.title: Musclebound
results.brief_description: Bigorexia, “The Disease”. By definition every serious bodybuilder has it. And the relentless drive to grow it engenders, will push the afflicted through every pain barrier - punishing weights regimes and severe diets alike. This is a short piece about the mania of muscle building, body sculpting, unbridled narcissism and obsession; the drive for elusive physical perfection which keeps the bodybuilder pumping iron and gorging protein day in day out. Starring three times Mr Universe Charlie Duca and his sidekick training partner Jeff Hinch, as well as colossal ex-bodybuilder now personal trainer Big Al, the film will explore this extreme ‘sport’ which may be more appropriately termed a neurosis. Enter a culture where men heave huge slabs of metal into the air, eat kilos of boiled chicken breast, and then stand in front of a mirror and assess the symmetricality of their limbs with tape measures. As one ex builder says: “Michelangelo did it with stone. Some do it with clay, others with plaster. The bodybuilder does it with flesh.” But at what cost? - Sacha Ettinger-Epstein, 2004

results.title: Muscle
results.creator_credit: Andreas Poulsson, ONF | NFB and Barry Lank
results.brief_description: Pat Feras, who is a social worker by profession, spends most of her leisure hours body building. This film shows Pat training for, and competing in, a women’s body building championship and includes fascinating footage, of the championship, both from backstage and upfront.

results.title: Murrayville Consolidated School
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development and E.J. Perry
results.brief_description: Documentary about a co-educational school in Murrayville, Victoria which began as a single room class in 1914 to a consolidated school by 1946. Children from about a dozen areas including Manya North, Kadoon, Gunamalary, Ngallo Sunset etc were picked up by bus from their rural homes.

results.title: Murray River trip per 'Marion' July 1940
results.brief_description: Home movie of trip taken along the Murray River in July 1940 showing picturesque sights along the journey including the almond blossoms and oranges at Berri, South Australia; the junction of the Murray and Darling Rivers near Wentworth; the many lochs between Mildura to Morgan; paddle-steamers and a sunset on the Murray.

results.title: Murphy's law
results.brief_description: Recommends thinking pre-planning and organisation as the ways in which to break Murphy’s Law - “If anything can go wrong, it will”. Sponsored by insurance companies to encourage development of emergency plans etc.
